definition: "speech" or "words" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 149)/see also 言字旁[yan2 zi4 pang2]
to blame/to reprove/to reprimand/to expel/to oust/to reconnoiter/(of territory) to expand/saline marsh
to press charges/to file a complaint
to press charges/to file a complaint
complaint/to complain/to register a complaint (esp. as a customer)
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
to file a complaint/to appeal (to an authority, a higher court of justice etc)/complaint/appeal
to recount/to tell of/to relate/(fig.) (of a thing) to stand as testament to (some past history)
to say everything (that is on one's mind)
(of a defendant) to respond to a charge/to defend oneself

sentences.english: b: just let me know which day.
sentences.chinese: 决定好哪一天就吿诉我。

sentences.english: Would you narrate me your call digit?
sentences.chinese: 你能吿诉我你的电话号码吗？

sentences.english: This suit would therefore be more properly labeled as Mineral King v. Morton.
sentences.chinese: 因此，更确切地说，本案应该是“矿金峡谷诉莫顿”。

sentences.english: if you're interested in leasing trade, please let us know.
sentences.chinese: 如果你们有意做租赁贸易，请吿诉我们。

sentences.english: Case of Tort: EOS Engineering Corporation v. Xinjiang Electricity Production Company and etc.
sentences.chinese: 美国EOS工程公司诉新绛发电公司等侵权纠纷案。

sentences.english: And the Gome Electric Manufacturing Company's Prosecution with the Sanlian Group Company for infringement of the trademark " Sanlian " .
sentences.chinese: 以及国美电器诉三联集团侵犯“三联”商标权案。

sentences.english: Not here the mourner would his grief reveal.
sentences.chinese: 吊客就无需来这儿诉他的悲思。

sentences.english: She told me she wanted to begin a corporation.
You have been keeping the truth from me .
sentences.chinese: 你一直不把真相吿诉我。

sentences.english: Ocular symptoms are a frequent presenting chief complaint from patients in the outpatient setting.
sentences.chinese: 在门诊中经常可以遇到以眼部症状为主诉的病人。

definition: private prosecution (law)/(of a patient) to describe (one's symptoms)
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
common plea/civil appeal (as opposed to criminal case)
